q: last few years- and it certainly has- much of blame falls on Eric Schmidt . His haughty, creepy, and occasionally insulting way of addressing the company's approach to privacy is href="http://www.theregister.co.uk/2010/10/25/Eric Schmidt_on_street_view/"> notorious. Google policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it, he once said, unwittingly showing that Google's policy is just the opposite. His efforts to paint such comments as humor only made the situation worse. The irony is that when he steps down as CEO

will not seek the Republican nomination for Barack Obama in 2012. Mike Pence ruled out a White House bid in a letter sent to supporters that also fueled speculation he is instead planning a run for governor. We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home, Mike Pence wrote in the letter.`` In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for Barack Obama in 2012.''

Senior Vice President Satya Nadella to president of Microsoft's Server and Tools Business.`` We're already making strong traction across our Server and Tools Business by embracing cloud services,'' said Microsoft Chief Executive Officer Steve Ballmer . Satya Nadella has deep experience in both our server business and online services, which will help accelerate our momentum while setting the course to deliver the cloud computing scenarios of the future. As president of the Server and Tools Business, Satya Nadella will oversee the overall strategy, engineering, marketing and product development for Microsoft's server, tools and cloud platform efforts. Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile, Chairman and CEO Eric Schmidt said in a statement.
